title: core
text:
source



 read_chronicle (dataset:str)

Read a chronicle parquet file into a polars dataframe.




Type
Details




dataset
str
Path to dataset


Returns
DataFrame





z = read_chronicle("./data/v1/metrics")
assert type(z) == pl.dataframe.frame.DataFrame

z = read_chronicle("./data/v1/logs")
assert type(z) == pl.dataframe.frame.DataFrame

title: core
text:
describe_measures

source

describe_measures

 describe_measures (x:polars.dataframe.frame.DataFrame)

Reads metrics dataframe and returns a pandas dataframe with summary of service, name and description of all metrics




Type
Details




x
DataFrame
metrics dataframe


Returns
DataFrame





m = read_chronicle("./data/v1/metrics/")
describe_measures(m)

title: py-chronicle
text:
** Work in progress **
The purpose of this experimental package is to expose functionality to make it easy to read, filter and manipulate chronicle parquet files.

title: py-chronicle
text:
How to use
Some examples.

read_chronicle("./data/v1/metrics").head()

title: core
text:
get_metric_values


get_metric_values

 get_metric_values (x:polars.dataframe.frame.DataFrame, name:str,
                    alias:str)

Extract a single metric from a metrics dataframe




Type
Details




x
DataFrame
metrics dataframe


name
str
name of metric to extract


alias
str
alias to use for new column


Returns
DataFrame





m = read_chronicle("./data/v1/metrics/")
get_metric_values(m, "cpu_percent", "cpu")
